alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lauderdale and northwestern Colbert Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 430 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Cherokee, or 11 miles east of J P Coleman State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Underwood-Petersville, Wright, Zip City, Threet and Oakland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Alabama.
